transcript.text: Hi everyone, I am Putin Manitwa studying
robotics and meatronics engineering at
Swimburn University of Technology.
During the course of this video, I will
discuss a key problem in a township in
the Northern Territory of Australia and
how I propose we solve it. The township
in question is Yuendum, a remote
indigenous community located within
Australia's Tanami Desert. It is home to
the Walpiri people and has a population
of about 700 to 800 citizens. One of the
biggest, if not the biggest problem that
this township face is the frequent power
outages. An average of 82% of the people
get disconnected from the electricity
once per day.
Inherently, this is going to cause major
disruptions to their everyday life
activities. The main aspect of those
that we will focus in this presentation
would be the communication aspect of the
issue.
With these frequent power outages, it is
granted that you can't necessarily use
the most advanced communication devices
such as mobile phones, radios, etc. To
add to this, due to the remote nature of
this township, the cellular service of
this township is extremely poor.
The objective of this presentation is
essentially to solve this discussed
aspect of the issue faced by the people
of the UNU and increase the living
standards of these citizens.
With that contextualization, I will move
on to my proposition. My design idea is
to make a shoe that generates
electricity while you walk. The basic
way this functions is by harnessing the
energy us humans generate while walking.
Every time we take a step, the
spring-loaded hinge will be pressed in,
transferring the highinetic energy to a
wheel, which will then transfer the
energy to a dynamo to be converted into
electricity.
Finally, this electricity will be stored
in a rechargeable battery to be used for
later use. The current implementation of
this shoe is at a very prototype level.
So it won't look like the most efficient
piece of tech. But it but it is only
here to give an idea of the fundamental
way of the design and functions and
further calibrations and improvements
will be made.
The biggest objectives that I tried to
fulfill through this design idea was to
make a portable power source that
citizens can use to power their
essential communication devices that
didn't depend on the power grid because
of its unreliability while harnessing
energy from a clean energy source and
not adapt to nature. Especially because
indigenous citizens have a massive
sentimental value to their environment.
Diving into the technologies used in
this device. The fundamental concept
that this idea is based upon will be
electromagnetic induction which is a
fancy way of saying producing current
from cutting a magnetic field by a coil.
Additionally, we have technologies like
battery storage to store the electricity
produced by the shoe. There will be a
voltage regulator to spit out a more
stable power output. What this means is
that it rectifies the sudden bumps in
voltages that happen every time you take
a step and you take your foot off. This
is done by charging capacitors and
discharging them when the output voltage
is going down.
On top of that, I intend to have a
cellular modem attached to this shoe
that will amplify cellular networks to
improve the cellular service you will
receive. Think of it as a hotspot built
into your shoe. And finally, there will
be health monitoring sensors built in so
every user can have their vitals
monitored all the time.
Before concluding this presentation, I
would like to give some attention to a
few weaknesses this design idea
currently possess. Like mentioned
previously, the design idea of this shoe
is currently not very userfriendly. So,
it may incentivize people to not use it
as much. Secondly, the lithium batteries
inside the shoe will degrade over time
and these shoes will have to be
considered e-waste eventually.
And one other huge limitation of the
shoe is that it can only power
electronics in a very small scale.
Basically, anything that can be powered
by USB. And with all that said, I would
like to say that this idea does have a
lot of potential and could potentially
grow out of these constraints and
limitations. I will make sure the design
idea is further elaborated and improved
to make sure the maximum benefits are
taken and improve the communication
quality of the people in YMU amongst the
township and with the rest of the world.
I am Putin Waitn and this is my design
idea the smart shoe.
